text: Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Mega intensywny i słodki. Potężne jagody, borówki, trochę mniej intensywne, ale jak najbardziej wyraźne masło orzechowe :3 miut
From the 750 ml bottle. A brown like color with big peanut butter aroma and taste is all peanut butter and sandwich.

Bottle shared with the KL tasting crew. Poured a clear red burgundy colour. The aroma is dry nutty, sweaty socks, sweet sugary red berry fruit. The flavour is moderate to strong sweet with a smooth rich sweet oily, fruity blueberry jelly palate. Medium to full bodied with flat carbonation.
MBCC. Clear red with no head. Aroma is honey, berries, wood and notes of peanut butter. Flavour is honey, berries, sweet, wood, sugar, rich, little peanut butter and warming.
Bottle - pours purple - nose and taste of roast peanut, bread crust, grape and blueberry jelly with some roast honey - medium body
Pours clear ruby, nose is herbal, blueberry, peanut butter, taste is peanut butter, juicy fruit, honey.
Pours clear bright red. Nose is berry jam, peanuts, juicy, sweet. Tastes peanuts, berries, honey, sweet.

Hay, burnt milk, roasted nuts, honey, molasses. Clear red, no head. Heavy sweet. More roasted nuts, intense fruitiness, red fruits, redcurrant, cherries, peanuts, soft carbonation, full bodied. Beautiful Mead, nice roasted peanuts. Keg at MBCC Red Session, Copenhagen.
MBCC. Hazy deep red without head. Aroma is sweet, honey, red berries and light peanut butter. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish. Oily. 130517

Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017, red session. Clear ruby color, no head. Aroma has honey, propolis and gummy bears. Really sweet but towards the finish I also got a hint of a nutty bitterness.
Mbcc red. Candy cherry clear. Slight vegetal, leafy nose. Cookie dough. Intense full sugary body. Ripe strawberries, cookie dough, light twigsy woody. Nice.
Sampled at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Clear ruby pour with no head. Notes of honey, strawberries, sweet grapes. Super fruity and sweet.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 Keg at cbc17 Red... Deep red... Thin white lacing... Soft dry peanut butter nose... Soft fruits... Massive peanut butter... How Wierd... Very fruity with odd peanut butter ...Dark fruits.. Rich and sweet 


Deep red .. ...thin whine lacing .. soft nutty peanut nose .. soft fruits .. massive nutty peanuts .. very sweet  4.0

13-MAY-2017, draft @MBCC 2017, Red Session, with Ulkløbben.
Red, no head. Sweet, berries, peanut butter, grapes. No carbonation, sweet, strange.

MBCC, red session.
The mead was intense red. Lots of sweetness, honey, berries and some nutt notes when you know to look for it. 
Berry sweetness, honey, nuts in flavor. long intense, lovely flavors.

duft: lidt jordslået nød rød kant kara
smag super sød jordslået kant nød lidt stærk eftersmag
Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Red Session. Klare leuchtend rötliche Farbe. Geruch nach roten Früchten, Honig, Vanille. Geschmack nach Erdnüssen, rote Beeren, Honig, klebrig, wow.
Draft - Roasty peanuts and sweet berry. Clear ruby red. Peanut butter and jelly. Tastes and smells as it should. Just not a fan.
Tap at MBCC2017, Copenhagen. Color is deep red with very small white head. Aromas and flavors: Sweetness, spices, berries, nuts and honey.

Pours clear red with flat head. Aroma of peanut butter and jelly... this awesome, and a bit weird. Taste is super sweet but you can really pick out the peanut butter. Rich and sweet, sticky body with nearly flat carbonation.
Pours clear burgundy with no head. Aroma is peanut butter and raspberry. Taste is peanut butter, raspberry sweet, honey sweet.

Bottle at ratebeer gathering. Pours out red purple no head. Nose is crazy grape jam the peanut butter notes honey sweetness. Taste is more of the peanut butter jam mix its is so fun to try along with a nice honey sweetness.
Bottle. Pours a dark ruby with no head. The aroma is strong grape jam, peanuts, honey, booze. Thick, jammy, berry, peanuts, nice sweetness, light booze, really enjoyed this.
At RateBeer Best 2017. Comes a dark reddish purple. Aroma of grapes and peanuts. Taste is grapes, peanuts, and honey. Enjoyed this one.
Tap @Mikkeller, Bangkok. Clear, dark red with small offwhite head. Honey and peanut aroma. Flavour has honey, sweet berries and peanuts. Light carb. Lovely
Swingtop 750, B1 103/245. Dark purple crimson color. Aroma is grape jelly and honey. Taste is sweetness and grapes, lots of jelly flavor.

@RBB
Near purple. People were excited when the first two kicked and this came on. It did a good approximation of a honey drizzled pbj sandwhich, but was juuust a touch too over the top for me. Not any sweeter than the marion (they both were very sweet) but I liked that one better.
Pours berry purple. Aroma is nutty with mild jammy notes. Flavor is jelly up front, mild grape juice with some tannins. Peanuts come in near end. Earth, drys out a bit.
Big depth mead. Pours soft, clear deep red. Aromas of jam, tannins, peanuts, caramel and spice Taste is jammy, tannins, light tart, nutty dryness, caramel even chocolate Nice!
Beautiful aged mead, characters of peanuts and blueberry. Nutty and strong alcohol in a balanced warming way. Superb!

Pours dark red with small head. Aroma of sweet fruit and strawberry jam, winey and Honey, syrup and oily peanuts. Taste is sweet and with a slightly tart finish. Notes of jam, syrup, peanuts, wine. Balanced.

Smooth pour. The aroma is really strong fruit and nut with light phenolic in a good way. Amazing blackberry or blueberry jam, and big honey. The honey andalcohol once finish off very strong .The mouth feel is light and strong

From notes. Enjoyed at Corbets house during a tasting on October 17. 750 mL bottle. The pour is a nice deep ruby color, really clear, with no head and no lace accordingly. The aroma is really good. There is a light peanut butter, an excellent blackberry or blueberry jam, and a lightly spicy honey. You can even smell the bread on this damn thing. Its like youre getting a nice PB&J on toasted wheat bread with a light alcohol finally coming in as it warms. The flavor is just as good. The peanut butter isnt thick and heavy, but light and flavorful. The jamminess of the berries is definitely in there and absolutely lovely. The honey and a light alcohol once again poke through on the end .The mouth feel is light and syrupy without any carbonation. Its a little thin for sure. The aftertaste is lingeringly bready and a beautiful peanut butter and preserves on the back end. This is really fucking good. Just wish it was a little thicker.
Sample from bottle, thanks Lukas! Deep red pour with purple hues. Notes of juicy berries, raspberries, currants, blueberries, some light oily notes and light nutty. Delicious!

From bottle thanks alot to LukasMH! Pours a deep vinous ruby red clear. Aroma has strong fruit vinous notes, tannic, strawberry, cherries, blueberry, weak spicy honey, not much peanut in the aroma though. Hmm.. Taste is pretty tart, again vinous tannic, obviously a high sugar content, but strong acidic notes dominates the taste. Maybe a slight nutty bitter/dry finish, leading to a weird, oxidised, syrup-covered cheesy note in the far after taste. If i didnt know any better i would have guessed this to be a port or cherry wine, lol. Super nice oily texture! Good, but not close to the last many superstitions ive had.
Sample big thanks to Lukasmh! Pours still clear deep red. Aromas of jam, tannins, peanuts, caramel, honey. Taste is jammy, tannins, light tart, nutty dryness, caramel, peanutbutter oil. Nice!

Big thanks to Lukas! Pours deep oily red with no head. Aroma of sweet rhubarb and strawberry jam, vinous, Honey, syrup and oily peanuts. Taste is sweet oily and with a rather dry end. Notes of jam, syrup, oily peanuts, vinous and wild honey. Balanced, smooth and delicate.
Purple pour. Amazing. Pure blueberry jam and peanut butter. The Peanut butter comes through as freshly ground peanuts. Blueberry jam. Slight tartness. Tiny hint of honey. Wow.

Nutty and berry smell with a hint of alcohol. Taste is much more berry and grape jelly with a strong peanut butter presence, especially in the finish. This is straight up PB&J in a glass. Nice thick sticky body.

The nose starts out with peanut butter and a hint of toasted bread. The taste is peanut butter with a blueberry finish. Truly a peanut butter jelly sandwich in a glass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Im blown away by what these guys create in meads. The aroma and palate are just like the name implies. Its straight peanut butter and blueberry jelly. This needs to be done in its own series with strawberries and raspberries. The only thing from making this one of my favorites meads, from Superstition, is the blueberries. Change it to strawberry, and this may be my favorite mead.
